title: An Accuser’s Story Suggests How Trump Might Appear in the Epstein Files
summary: A former Jeffrey Epstein employee said that she told the F.B.I. in 1996 and 2006 about what she considered a troubling encounter with Donald J. Trump.

title: What to Know About the Fallout Around the Epstein Files and the Trump Administration
summary: Here’s what to know about the disturbing facts and unsubstantiated suspicions that make Jeffrey Epstein, a registered sex offender, a politically potent obsession.

title: A Push for More Organ Transplants Is Putting Donors at Risk
summary: People across the United States have endured rushed or premature attempts to remove their organs. Some were gasping, crying or showing other signs of life.

title: Dozens Are Killed at Aid Site Near Border, Gaza Health Officials Say
summary: The shootings took place after thousands of Palestinians gathered in the hope of getting humanitarian aid from U.N. trucks entering the Gaza Strip.

title: What to Know About the Deadly Shootings Near a Gaza Aid Site
summary: At least 32 people were reported killed on Saturday, and more than 60 a day later, adding to the mounting death toll of Gazans who have lost their lives trying to get food.

title: After a Chaotic Start, a U.S. Attorney’s Time May Be Running Out
summary: Alina Habba, President Trump’s choice to run the U.S. attorney’s office in New Jersey, has pursued investigations against Democrats. Her tenure has damaged morale inside the office.

title: Should ICE Agents Be Allowed to Wear Masks? It Depends Whom You Ask.
summary: Los Angeles’s mayor said Sunday that masked immigration agents helped create a “reign of terror.” ICE’s director said agents could wear masks to “keep them and their families safe.”

title: Justin Fulcher, a Top Aide to Pete Hegseth, Leaves the Pentagon
summary: Justin Fulcher, an adviser to Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, said in a statement that he had planned to work in the federal government for only six months.

title: Canceling ‘The Late Show’ Is Bad News for Late-Night TV, not Stephen Colbert
summary: The art form was already in decline; this may hasten its demise. But don’t fret about the host. His talents are better showcased elsewhere.

title: Faint Signs of Life Appear in Effort to Halt Ukraine War
summary: Ukraine’s president proposed reviving talks brokered by the Trump administration, which seemed stalled a month ago.

title: How Did the Number of People Missing After Texas Floods Drop So Drastically?
summary: Last week, officials said 97 people were missing in Kerr County. Now, it’s down to three. The drop is substantial, but such wild fluctuations can happen after disasters.

title: Maddie, a Coonhound Who Awed Instagram by Balancing on Things, Dies at 14
summary: In thousands of photos, Maddie stood tall and seemingly unbothered atop fences, cars, road signs and tires, garnering 1.2 million Instagram followers along the way.

title: Why American Jews No Longer Understand One Another
summary: The consensus that held them together for generations is breaking down.

title: Jake Larson, D-Day Veteran and TikTok Star, Dies at 102
summary: Mr. Larson, the last survivor of a unit that stormed Omaha Beach in 1944, shared his memories on social media where he amassed a wide following.

title: Mamdani Travels to Uganda in Break From Mayoral Campaign
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee for mayor of New York, said that he and his wife were going to the African country where he was born to celebrate their recent marriage.

title: The K-Pop Band Big Ocean Is Making Waves With Sign Language
summary: Big Ocean, a boy band whose members are deaf or hard of hearing, has found success with a mix of singing and signing.
